1.details: 1. Research modern OS architectures (monolithic, microkernel, hybrid). 2. Design system architecture for multi-device support. 3. Define kernel design philosophy. 4. Create technical specifications document.

2.content: Setup Development Environment and Build System
2.details: 1. Configure cross-compilation toolchains for multiple architectures (x86, ARM, RISC-V). 2. Setup build system (GNU Make/Bazel). 3. Create bootable ISO/image generation. 4. Setup virtual machine testing environment.

3.content: Implement Bootloader and Basic Boot Process
3.details: 1. Write custom bootloader or adapt existing one. 2. Implement UEFI/BIOS compatibility. 3. Basic memory management initialization. 4. Multi-stage boot process for different devices.

4.details: 1. Memory management (paging, heap allocation). 2. Process/thread management and scheduling. 3. Interrupt handling and system calls. 4. Basic I/O and device drivers framework.

5.details: 1. Hardware abstraction layer (HAL) for different architectures. 2. Device driver framework. 3. Support for CPU architectures (x86, ARM64, RISC-V). 4. Basic peripheral drivers (keyboard, display, storage).

6.details: 1. Design custom file system or implement existing ones (FAT32, ext2). 2. Virtual file system (VFS) layer. 3. Storage device drivers. 4. File operations (open, read, write, close).

7.details: 1. System call interface. 2. Process communication (IPC). 3. Basic system services (time, random, I/O). 4. POSIX-like API compatibility layer.

8.details: 1. Basic CLI shell and command interpreter. 2. Simple graphics driver and framebuffer. 3. Window management system. 4. Basic GUI toolkit and windowing.

9.details: 1. Desktop PC support (BIOS/UEFI, x86_64). 2. Mobile/tablet support (ARM, touch interface). 3. IoT device support (minimal footprint, embedded). 4. Server/cloud features (multi-core optimization, virtual memory).

10.details: 1. Comprehensive testing suite. 2. User and developer documentation. 3. Installation scripts and media creation. 4. Community resources and tutorials.
